featured.text: The next day, Amir loaded the sacks ___(38)___ with salt but with sand.

Then we were each separately sent on what was grandly referred to as a cruise in my father’s 18-foot boat, spending the night on board, and loaded down, according to my mother, with enough food for a week.

definition.en_def: To put a load on or in something; to fill or place something into a container or vehicle.
definition.example: We need to load the boxes onto the truck before we leave.
